meanings.definition: A person inclined to question or doubt accepted opinions.
meanings.sent1: The skeptics in the group always ask many questions.
meanings.sent2: Many skeptics doubted the new scientific theory.
meanings.sent3: The skeptics at the comedy show questioned if the jokes were really funny.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a room full of skeptics, always questioning everything.
meanings.sent5: The image of the skeptics sitting in the back row, arms crossed, is hard to forget.

meanings.definition: A person who maintains a doubting attitude, as toward values, plans, statements, or the character of others.
meanings.sent1: The skeptics at the meeting were not easily convinced.
meanings.sent2: She was known as one of the biggest skeptics in the office.
meanings.sent3: The skeptics at the party doubted the sincerity of the host's smile.
meanings.sent4: His eyes held a look of skepticism, as if he didn't believe a word.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with skeptics, each with a different reason to doubt.
